intro: Sida glechomifolia, commonly known as Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply lobed and resemble those of the common mallow. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Sida glechomifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
